Content-Type: text/plain;

Nightshift hesitates for a moment and then starts to dig at the snow, mindi=
ng his actions so he doesn't kick up too much activity to be noticed.   He =
finds the opening and stops to scan it for trip alarms.  

" Yep, it's here=
 like ya said, Sir.  Scanning for trip alarm beams now.  Noth'n is too easy=
 when it looks it.  Learned that in special ops training."

Don't be enviou=
s of what you don't have, be grateful for things you already posses.  Nothi=
ng is worth more than family and friends.

On Nov 16, 2011, at 5:59 AM, Sup=
er Cyclonus <supercyclonus@...> wrote:

> > <OLD>
> >
> > Nightshift =
looks back to Wolfgang with a slightly sarcastic look on his
> > face. Snow=
 laces his ebony whiskers and frosts his jet black fur. He
> > ripples it a=
s the snow falls on him.
> >
> > " Yeah, yeah. Just wait till we get a job =
in the tropics, when you're
> > panting up a storm, I will be the one who's=
 laugh'n. Anyway we better not
> > have ta be out here for too much longer,=
 who knows who's out there,or what's
> > out there, just look'n ta take us =
out."
> 
> <NEW>
> 
> WOLFGANG chuckled, "We'll see, we'll see."
> 
> As th=
ey were talking the group was already making the long trek down,
> but this=
 time PROWL was staying close to the ground with the group.
> With the open=
 weaponry showing from CRYONOSIS, he didn't want to take
> a chance that th=
e defenses would open up on him as they came down.
> 
> The trip back down =
to the ground took another several hours. The path
> again was winding and =
in some places treacherous and narrow, but it
> eventually dropped them off=
 at the base of the mountain. At the same
> time the snow, although light, =
was continuing to fall.
> 
> "There." POLAR CLAW said as he pointed with hi=
s paw. "There is the
> auxiliary hatch. You can get in over there." What PO=
LAR CLAW was
> pointing at looked to be just another patch of the ever deep=
ening
> snow. If there was an opening, it was well hidden.
> 
> (TAG)
> 
> =
-Preston
> 

--Apple-Mail-DCC93418-2C23-46CA-8393-6A4E0B31B3BA

<html><head></head><body bgcolor=3D"#FFFFFF"><div>Nightshift hesitates for =
a moment and then starts to dig at the snow, minding his actions so he does=
n't kick up too much activity to be noticed.   He finds the opening an=
d stops to scan it for trip alarms.  </div><div><br></div><div>" Yep, =
it's here like ya said, Sir.  Scanning for trip alarm beams now. &nbsp=
;Noth'n is too easy when it looks it.  Learned that in special ops tra=
ining."<br><br>Don't be envious of what you don't have, be grateful for thi=
ngs you already posses.  Nothing is worth more than family and friends=
.</div><div><br>On Nov 16, 2011, at 5:59 AM, Super Cyclonus <<a href=3D"=
mailto:supercyclonus@...">supercyclonus@...</a>> wrote:<br><=
br></div><div></div><blockquote type=3D"cite"><div>

le=3D"display:none"> </span>



    <div id=3D"ygrp-text">
      
    =
  
      <p>> <OLD><br>
><br>
> Nightshift looks back to Wol=
fgang with a slightly sarcastic look on his<br>
> face.  Snow laces his =
ebony whiskers and frosts his jet black fur.  He<br>
> ripples it as the=
 snow falls on him.<br>
><br>
> " Yeah, yeah.  Just wait till we get =
a job in the tropics, when you're<br>
> panting up a storm, I will be th=
e one who's laugh'n.  Anyway we better not<br>
> have ta be out here for=
 too much longer, who knows who's out there,or what's<br>
> out there, j=
ust look'n ta take us out."<br>
<br>
<NEW><br>
<br>
WOLFGANG chuckled=
, "We'll see, we'll see."<br>
<br>
As they were talking the group was alrea=
dy making the long trek down,<br>
but this time PROWL was staying close to =
the ground with the group.<br>
With the open weaponry showing from CRYONOSI=
S, he didn't want to take<br>
a chance that the defenses would open up on h=
im as they came down.<br>
<br>
The trip back down to the ground took anothe=
r several hours. The path<br>
again was winding and in some places treacher=
ous and narrow, but it<br>
eventually dropped them off at the base of the m=
ountain. At the same<br>
time the snow, although light, was continuing to f=
all.<br>
<br>
"There." POLAR CLAW said as he pointed with his paw. "There i=
s the<br>
auxiliary hatch. You can get in over there." What POLAR CLAW was<=
br>
pointing at looked to be just another patch of the ever deepening<br>
s=
now. If there was an opening, it was well hidden.<br>
<br>
(TAG)<br>
<br>
-=
Preston<br>
